description:
Based on Papergames' otome dating simulation game.

The heroine has inherited a company from her late father and is now in charge of a television program as its producer. However, the company is on the brink of bankruptcy due to the lack of capital. While trying to save her father's once popular program and company, she meets four potential "boyfriends." However, before she knew it, she is caught in a huge conspiracy over special powers known as "Evol."

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/munehisa_sakai)

Previoulsy affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation) and [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA). Currently working at [Studio KAI](https://anilist.co/studio/6312/Studio-KAI).
Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.

**Birthplace:** Osaka Prefecture, Japan

**Katou Yuusuke** is a Japanese lyricist, composer and arranger.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/munehisa_sakai)

Previoulsy affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation) and [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA). Currently working at [Studio KAI](https://anilist.co/studio/6312/Studio-KAI).
Former Head of the Production Department at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). Currently Producer at Chocolate Inc.

[Website](http://konomi-suzuki.net/) | [Old Blog](http://ameblo.jp/galapa-konomi) | [New Blog](http://ameblo.jp/konomi-suzuki/)

Konomi Suzuki is a Japanese singer from Osaka Prefecture who is signed to Amuleto. After winning the Animax All-Japan Anisong Grand Prix in 2011, she made her debut in 2012 with the release of her first single "Choir Jail", which peaked at 34 on the Oricon charts; the title track of which was used as the opening theme to the anime television series Dusk Maiden of Amnesia. She released her first album 17, in 2014, two albums in 2015, and a further album Lead, in 2016.

Suzuki cites the character Sheryl Nome from Macross Frontier as her inspiration for making music for anime. Her music has been featured in anime series such as The Pet Girl of Sakurasou, No Matter How I Look at It, It's You Guys' Fault I'm Not Popular!, No Game No Life, and Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World. She has also performed in events in Japan such as Animelo Summer Live and Animax Musix, and at international events in China, Germany, the United States, and Southeast Asia. In 2018, Suzuki made her voice acting debut, playing the role of Rin in the anime television series Lost Song.

[Website](https://www.miura-yutaro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yutaro_3ura) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yutaro_3ura/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/yutaro-miura/)

A Japanese singer-songwriter. He married the voice actor and musician [Yui Makino](https://anilist.co/staff/95089/Yui-Makino) on June 12, 2020.
